p: Even though more than 90 antiviral drugs are currently approved for the treatment of viral infections, many are suitable for use only with a single virus ( De Clercq and Li, 2016). New antiviral drugs with activity against multiple viral types are being sought, and many of these compounds are undergoing advanced clinical trials ( Chaudhuri et al., 2018). Several of these drugs are used for diseases caused by herpesviruses.
